BNB Chain closed Q3 2025 with one of its strongest quarters in over a year.

From user activity and DeFi growth to infrastructure upgrades and MEV protection, the data shows broad, real momentum.

Here‚Äôs the Q3 snapshot, by @Messari üßµüëá 
Q3 was a breakout quarter for BNB Chain:

‚Ä¢ Market cap ‚Üë51.6% to $140.4B
‚Ä¢ Daily transactions ‚Üë35.3% to 13.3M
‚Ä¢ Daily active addresses ‚Üë47.1% to 2.3M
‚Ä¢ DeFi TVL ‚Üë30.7% to $7.8B
‚Ä¢ Stablecoin market cap ‚Üë32.3% to $13.9B
‚Ä¢ Daily DEX volume ‚Üë29.6% to $2.4B

Read on for the full Q3 breakdown üëá
$BNB‚Äôs market cap grew 51.6% QoQ to $140.4B in Q3.

That made BNB the 5th largest crypto asset by market cap by quarter end, reflecting strong price performance alongside rising network usage. 
Usage accelerated across the network.

‚Ä¢ Average daily transactions rose 35.3% QoQ to 13.3M
‚Ä¢ Daily active addresses grew 47.1% to 2.3M

Growth came from DeFi, stablecoins, NFTs, and high-frequency trading apps. 
The average cost per transaction fell in Q3 after the Lorentz and Maxwell upgrades, even as daily transactions climbed past 13M.

After the Lorentz and Maxwell upgrades, gas prices dropped sharply, reducing the fee users paid per transaction even as activity increased across the network.

Lower costs, higher throughput, same scale.
BNB Chain‚Äôs DeFi TVL rose 30.7% QoQ to $7.8B.

By the end of Q3, BNB Chain became the third-largest network by TVL, led by @pancakeswap, @lista_dao, and @Aster_DEX's growth. 
DEX activity continued to expand.

‚Ä¢ Average daily DEX volume grew 29.6% QoQ to $2.4B
‚Ä¢ BNB Chain ranked second among all chains by DEX volume
‚Ä¢ Liquidity broadened beyond a single venue 
Stablecoins became a major growth driver in Q3.

‚Ä¢ Stablecoin market cap rose 32.3% QoQ to $13.9B
‚Ä¢ Growth was broad across issuers, including yield-bearing and synthetic assets
‚Ä¢ The 0-Fee Carnival continued to reduce onboarding friction 
Infrastructure maturity stood out this quarter.

‚Ä¢ Reth client alpha launched with faster syncs and lower latency
‚Ä¢ 99.8% of blocks used the Builder API
‚Ä¢ Sandwich attacks fell by more than 95% through MEV protections 
Q3 2025 marked a quarter of broad expansion for BNB Chain.

More users, deeper liquidity, stronger infrastructure, and continued progress across DeFi, stablecoins, and onchain trading.

Full report by Messari below üëá
https://messari.io/report/state-of-bnb-chain-q3-2025

According to CoinGecko data, blockchain interest in 2025 continues to be dominated by Solana, Base, and Ethereum.
Solana stands out in particular, capturing roughly 27% of total attention. This indicates sustained concentration of interest not merely driven by price action, but by what users are actually viewing, exploring, and using.
Meanwhile, Ethereum, BNB Chain, and Sui are closely matched, highlighting intensifying competition across ecosystems. Notably, Bitcoin‚Äôs share remains around just 1%, suggesting that the center of attention is shifting away from pure ‚Äústore of value‚Äù narratives toward applications and user experience.
The next main battleground will not be price, but user engagement, time spent, and real demand.

A new stablecoin backed by WLFI, which has reported connections to Donald Trump‚Äôs circle, is making moves by launching on Cantor Network. 

This marks another step in a series of expansion efforts, raising fresh questions about its ambitions. 
2/ WLFI‚Äôs USD1 stablecoin is now active on Cantor Network, following earlier launches on Solana, Polygon, and BNB Chain.

The latest move aligns with WLFI‚Äôs stated goal to broaden access and drive stablecoin utility across multiple chains.
3/ Cross-chain expansion can increase liquidity as USD1 reaches users beyond major networks.

Supporting more blockchains may improve ease of use and could help solidify USD1‚Äôs role as a multi-chain stablecoin solution.
4/ Rapid cross-chain moves put USD1 on new ground, reaching untapped users and liquidity.

Broader adoption could hinge on seamless integration, making future network support a key part of USD1‚Äôs growth trajectory.

MIND STARSHIP LOG 03 üõ∏

üß†World AI Health Hub

The World AI Health Hub is the first secure training ground for the "Internet of AI," established by deploying FHE infrastructure on BNB Chain and integrating @vana‚Äôs DataDAO architecture.

üß†Zero Trust Data Agent

For the first time, AI models can train on health data that remains fully encrypted at its core. FHE creates a "blind learning" environment where user privacy protection and AI model evolution run in parallel.

üß† Unlocking Medical Intelligence

We are breaking the paradox of healthcare: data silos vs. data utility. By enabling secure computation on sensitive information, we unlock global datasets for researchers, accelerating precision medicine and drug discovery without ever exposing patient identity.

üß† Sovereign Data Economy

Moving beyond simple storage to active computation. Users can now contribute value to medical AI research while maintaining absolute cryptographic ownership of their raw information.
